model

Enum Direction

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Direction>
      • model.Direction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Direction>

    public enum Direction
extends java.lang.Enum<Direction>
    An enumeration of the eight directions of travel from a given node on a 2-D grid.
    Author:
    Ken Norman

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      EAST
      For a node at (m, n), this represents the direction of node (m+1, n).
      NORTH
      For a node at (m, n), this represents the direction of node (m, n+1).
      NORTHEAST
      For a node at (m, n), this represents the direction of node (m+1, n+1).
      NORTHWEST
      For a node at (m, n), this represents the direction of node (m-1, n+1).
      SOUTH
      For a node at (m, n), this represents the direction of node (m, n-1).
      SOUTHEAST
      For a node at (m, n), this represents the direction of node (m+1, n-1).
      SOUTHWEST
      For a node at (m, n), this represents the direction of node (m-1, n-1).
      WEST
      For a node at (m, n), this represents the direction of node (m-1, n).

      • getDeltaX

        public final int getDeltaX()
        Get the change in the value of the x coordinate for a neighbor node located in a particular direction.
        Returns:
        The x coordinate multiplier. The value will only be one of 1, 0, or -1.

      • getDeltaY

        public final int getDeltaY()
        Get the change in the value of the y coordinate for a neighbor node located in a particular direction.
        Returns:
        The y coordinate multiplier. The value will only be one of 1, 0, or -1.

        public final double getCostToNeighbor()
        Get the cost to move from the current node to the neighbor node in a particular direction.
        Returns:
        The cost to move in this direction to the neighbor node.

      • getAdjacentPoint

        public final java.awt.Point getAdjacentPoint(int x,
                              int y)
        Gets the adjacent point based on an (x, y) coordinate.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of a given node.
        y - The y coordinate of a given node.
        Returns:
        A Point object representing the (x, y) coordinates of an adjacent node in a particular direction.

      • getAdjacentPoint

        public final java.awt.Point getAdjacentPoint(java.awt.Point p)
        Gets the adjacent point based on a (p.x, p.y) coordinate.
        Parameters:
        p - A Point object representing the (x, y) coordinates of a given node
        Returns:
        A Point object representing the (x, y) coordinates of a node adjacent to p in a particular direction.

        The adjacent direction moving clockwise around the compass.

        The adjacent direction moving clockwise around the compass.

      • fromAbbreviation

        public static final Direction fromAbbreviation(java.lang.String abbreviation)
        Get a Direction based on an abbreviation (N, NW, E, etc.).
        Parameters:
        abbreviation - The abbreviation.
        Returns:
        The Direction which corresponds to the abbreviation if such a match exists; returns null otherwise.

      • fromOffset

        public static final Direction fromOffset(int xOffset,
                   int yOffset)
        Get a Direction based on an integer offset.
        Parameters:
        xOffset - The x offset. Must be 1, 0, or -1.
        yOffset - The y offset. Must be 1, 0, or -1.
        Returns:
        The direction which corresponds to the x- and y-offsets. Returns null if both offsets are not in the integer range [-1, 1].

      • randomDirection

        public static final Direction randomDirection()
        Get a random Direction.
        Returns:
        A Direction chosen at random.
